intro: Eschscholzia modesta, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Eschscholzia modesta is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
